intro: Gnidia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, oval-shaped fruits. Its leaves are typically oval in shape, hence the species name, and are often covered in fine hairs. Gnidia ovalifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
